Bubble SortÂ¶

Bubble Sort is a simple comparison-based sorting algorithm. It repeatedly compares adjacent elements and swaps them if they are in the wrong order until the entire list is sorted.

Time Complexity: - Best Case: O(n) - when the input list is already sorted. - Average Case: O(n^2) - when the input list is randomly ordered. - Worst Case: O(n^2) - when the input list is sorted in reverse order.

Space Complexity: O(1) - Bubble Sort requires a constant amount of additional space.

Python implementation:

def bubble_sort(arr):
    n = len(arr)
    for i in range(n):
        for j in range(0, n - i - 1):
            if arr[j] > arr[j + 1]:
                arr[j], arr[j + 1] = arr[j + 1], arr[j]
